sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Koch island.
message_1: What is the perimeter of the Koch island after the 4th iteration if the length of the original triangle (before the first iteration) is 1 unit?
message_2:
The Koch island is formed by applying the Koch curve to each side of an equilateral triangle. After each iteration, the length of each side of the triangle is multiplied by 4/3. 

After the first iteration, the length of each side is 1 * (4/3) = 4/3 units.
After the second iteration, the length of each side is (4/3) * (4/3) = 16/9 units.
After the third iteration, the length of each side is (16/9) * (4/3) = 64/27 units.
After the fourth iteration, the length of each side is (64/27) * (4/3) = 256/81 units.

Since the Koch island is an equilateral triangle, the perimeter is the sum of the lengths of all three sides. Therefore, the perimeter after the 4th iteration is:

Perimeter = 3 * (256/81) = 768/81 units.
